intro: Hovea stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hovea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. It is well adapted to dry and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in arid regions. Hovea stricta plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
